#Text=Use a Napkin
#Text=with Proper Table Etiquette
#Text=The practice of good dining decorum involves a vast array of elements to consider .
#Text=You may already know the proper ways to use various utensils and how to eat diverse styles of dishes .
#Text=But one component that is constant throughout the dining experience is the use of the napkin .
#Text=Follow the steps below to use your napkin in such an elegant deportment that all your fellow guests will notice your neat civility .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Put your napkin on your lap , right away .
#Text=Once you have been seated by the host , the first and foremost thing you should do is pick up your napkin and without flicking it violently , unfold it and place it comfortably on your lap .
#Text=This is its home until either you need to go to the restroom , or the meal has finished .
#Text=Wipe your mouth with care .
#Text=During the meal , it will be customary that you will need to wipe your mouth at certain promptings .
#Text=To wipe your mouth , gently dab your mouth and allow the napkin to soak residue from the area .
#Text=It is also vital that you use your napkin before sipping your wine or other beverage , so you do n’t leave any greasy mouth excess on the lip of the glass .
#Text=Do not use it as a handkerchief .
#Text=At no stage during the meal should you use your napkin like a tissue as a means to blow your nose .
#Text=Simply excuse yourself from the table if you need to , and visit the bathroom instead .
#Text=Be careful when you get up .
#Text=If you do need to take a trip to the restroom during the meal , excuse yourself from the table and place your napkin neatly on the lap of your seat ( not the arm or the top ) until you return .
#Text=Never place it back onto the table during the meal .
#Text=Never wear your napkin like a cravat .
#Text=Toddlers wear bibs , not adults .
#Text=Wrap up at the end of the meal .
#Text=The host should signal that you have reached the end of the meal by placing his or her napkin on the table beside the plate ( never on it ) .
#Text=It is fine for you to mimic this gesture and at the same time thank them for a wonderful meal if you can .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you drop your napkin , kindly ask the host for a fresh one and avoid disturbing other diners by trying to pick it up .
#Text=Simply leave it until the end of the meal and place it up on the table afterwards .
#Text=Avoid using the napkin excessively .
#Text=Prior to taking a sip of your drink , the use of your napkin need not be lengthy .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Avoid using your napkin on other guests at the table within your vicinity .
#Text=It 's childish and unmannerly .
